Description: Body sherd of East Greek pottery bowl; interior glazed; exterior: at top, wide black band with superimposed added red and white bands; animal frieze below with part of two goats to left, heads turned back (rump with red, ear and antler remaining of left goat; most of foreparts of one to right); added red on bodies; groups of vertical strokes, rosettes and crosses as filling ornament; black band below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1223)
